abstract: The government-administered insurance fund that protects depositors fell $8.2 billion into the red for the first time since the savings-and-loan crisis of the early 1990s as the pace of bank failures accelerated in the third quarter.
snippet: The government-administered insurance fund that protects depositors fell $8.2 billion into the red for the first time since the savings-and-loan crisis of the early 1990s as the pace of bank failures accelerated in the third quarter.
lead_paragraph: The government-administered insurance fund that protects depositors fell $8.2 billion into the red for the first time since the fallout from the savings-and-loan crisis of the early 1990s as the pace of bank failures accelerated in the third quarter.

headline.main: U.S. Fund for Bank Deposit Insurance Falls Into the Red
